results.title: Is this the job for me: Jack of what trade
results.brief_description: This film is intended as a guide to young people of school leaving age who are faced with the problem of choosing a career. The film is a dramatised account of a school visit by a Youth Employment Officer, and his subsequent discussion with students and visits to industry. Suggests self-analysis by students to assess their special talents, interests, dispositions and physique in terms of their future employment.

results.title: Is this job for me? No. 5. Making boots and shoes
results.brief_description: Made for showing to children of school-leaving age. This film takes the student on a tour of a boot and shoe factory, illustrating firstly the methods by which a single craftsman makes a pair of shoes and then the way in which the same job is done using modern machinery.

results.title: Is there life after death?
results.creator_credit: Ivo Burum, Helen Gaynor, Alfred Hospital and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Nurses”.
Nurses “was filmed by four nurses and their friends at the Alfred Hospital in Melbourne to capture the real life drama of nursing from a very different perspective…their own” Nurses are: Kerryn O’Rourke - Oncology. Trish Builic - Psychiatric (to the homeless). Jane Newham - Emergency. Cassie Steward - Theatre. Ep 4. With Christmas and the Millenium coming up there are conclusions and last comments. There are holidays taken, shopping to be done and religion and beliefs are reflected upon. Jane demystifies the bed pan. One of Kerryn’s patients has rapidly deteriorated. Cassie becomes a patient. And Trish gets frustrated at the outpouring of good will on Christmas day and wonders where it all goes for the rest of the year.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ivo Burum, Helen Gaynor, Alfred Hospital and ABC-TV (Australia)

results.title: Is smoking worth it?
results.creator_credit: Myron Solin and American Cancer Society
results.brief_description: Shows four teenagers discussing why they do or do not smoke. Presents factual evidence linking cigarette smoking with lung cancer. Discusses the difficulty of giving up the habit of smoking. Suitable for secondary level.

results.title: Is it working ?
results.creator_credit: John Hughes, Archival Film Project of the Australia Council and Community Arts Board
results.brief_description: Long before the idea of community arts became a popular and welcome activity, George Seelaf was organising participatory art activities for workers in factories. This film looks at the influence that George Seelaf has exerted through his commitment to labour movement ideals; his support for radical artists and writers and his pioneering work for community arts. Seelaf established the Trade Union Clinic and Research Centre, now known as the Western Region Community Health Centre in Melbourne’s western suburbs. Secretary of the Australasian Meat Industry employees Union for 25 years he refused to accept the Order of Australia bestowed upon him because John Kerr was officiating. Includes interviews with Wally Curran, Frank Hardy, Noel Counihan and Andrew Reeves.
results.creator_credit_for_label: John Hughes, Archival Film Project of the Australia Council and Community Arts Board
